skillTree.name: Resplendence of Luminescents
skillTree.description: Bounding from branch to bow, the Luminescents’ magical spoors alight upon allies’ weapons to bestow a minor but lethal enchantment.

skillTree.name: Flurry of Boughs
skillTree.description: When at war under the canopy it is like the trees themselves join the fray, striking from all directions.

skillTree.name: Nettles of Malice
skillTree.description: The forest has myriad ways to cause discomfort, pain and death to those foolhardy enough to make unwanted contact with its denizens.

skillTree.name: Enchanted Photosynthesis
skillTree.description: Enhanced by magic, the laws of nature grant the wargrove a heightened ability to heal its ranks from light energy alone.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 5%

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Ancient Attendant
skillTree.description: Long before the arrival of the Elves, it was the Branchwraiths who served the treemen and tamed the winds of magic.

skillTree.name: Dark Spirit
skillTree.description: Not all spirits of Athel Loren are selfless, some are malevolent and twisted.

skillTree.name: Awakening of the Wood
skillTree.description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.name: Life Bloom
skillTree.description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

skillTree.name: Earth Blood
skillTree.description: The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached
Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

skillTree.name: Shield of Thorns
skillTree.description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Flesh to Stone
skillTree.description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

ui_effects.description: ➕Entities cannot die while ability is active
➕Entities cannot die while ability is active
➕Entities cannot die while ability is active
➕Entities cannot die while ability is active
➕Entities cannot die while ability is active

Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Regrowth
skillTree.description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

skillTree.name: The Dwellers Below
skillTree.description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

ui_effects.description: ➕ Deals 0 5 damage per second (25m). After explosion 100% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 1 entity per second
➕ Deals 0 5 damage per second (25m). After explosion 100% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 1 entity per second

Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for all spells

ui_effects.description: ➕ Improves power recharge rate by 1 every 7 seconds

skillTree.name: [Hidden] Awakening of the Wood
skillTree.description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Endurance of the Oak
skillTree.description: Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.

skillTree.name: Impenetrable Bark
skillTree.description: Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.

skillTree.name: Tempered Rigour
skillTree.description: When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.

skillTree.name: Violent Delights
skillTree.description: There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Aspect of the Oak
skillTree.description: Not even the fiercest weather conditions can strike down a hardy and long-lived oak, for it endures all seasons.

skillTree.name: Aspect of the Birch
skillTree.description: A birch’s oils can soften its wood, but once dry can harden branches into lethal clubs of war.

skillTree.name: Aspect of the Willow
skillTree.description: The willow is a harbinger of spring, and a conduit of lifeforces that can bolster a tree to withstand the direst of circumstances.

skillTree.name: Birch
skillTree.description: Dryads which shape shift into their Birch aspect take on a silvery-white appearance like birch trees, with a mass of delicate yellow green or tawny yellow foliage for hair. They are extremely vicious and spiteful and lash the foe with their long fingers which cut into flesh.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 for Dryads units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 for Dryads units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 for Dryads units

skillTree.name: Oak
skillTree.description: When Dryads shape shift into their Oak aspect, they become more robust and resilient to wounds. They assume a green or brown skin and their limbs thicken. Their hair becomes a mass of oak leaves and acorns.

skillTree.name: Willow
skillTree.description: In their Willow aspect, Dryads change into creatures with green skin and extremely long yellowish green hair which hangs down around them like the leaves of the weeping willow tree. Their fingers extend into incredibly long, whip-like willow twigs.

skillTree.name: Call of the Woods
skillTree.description: The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.

skillTree.name: Howl of the Forest
skillTree.description: The Lord's troops are charged to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.

skillTree.name: Renowned
skillTree.description: A legendary presence, on the battlefield and off.

skillTree.name: Retinue: Valet
skillTree.description: My lord, I believe I’ve found something of interest...

skillTree.name: Inspirational
skillTree.description: We all must fight, no matter our station.

skillTree.name: Retinue: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: I’ve managed to procure some additional supplies for the troops, my lord.

effects.description: Attrition: -3% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -7% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition

skillTree.name: Great Orator
skillTree.description: We will not allow them to take our homes, our lands!

skillTree.name: Retinue: Physician
skillTree.description: We will establish triage and treatment centers as soon as we make camp, my lord.

skillTree.name: {{tr:agent_action_name_replenish_troops}}
skillTree.description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 7%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 12%

skillTree.name: {{tr:agent_action_name_stimulate_growth}}
skillTree.description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.name: {{tr:agent_action_name_damage_walls}}
skillTree.description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.name: {{tr:agent_action_name_wound}}
skillTree.description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 4% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 10% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 18% chance of wounding target

skillTree.name: {{tr:agent_action_name_block_army}}
skillTree.description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.name: Specialist
skillTree.description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

skillTree.name: Maintenance
skillTree.description: FACTIONWIDE: all source of income: -0,5% and characters upkeep: +1%. Effects are additive. Negated on level 30 of character.

skillTree.name: Blight of Terrors
skillTree.description: Mirthfully looming out from their host, Terrors take on their most fearsome aspect to dampen the spirits of their horrified prey.

skillTree.name: Muster of Malevolents
skillTree.description: Unleashed upon a foe, these aggressive manifestations of the forest are utilised for their needle-like arrows that inflict painful wounds from afar.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 15% chance of wounding target

ui_effects.description: ➕50% chance to deal 150 direct damage to 1 entitiy per second
